Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PYY_mouse (Peptide YY, PC-PYY; natural AMPs; UCLL1c; mouse, rodents, mammals, animals, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: AMP Significance: a 2023 Science paper reveals that Peptide YY, a Paneth cell antimicrobial peptide, maintains Candida gut commensalism.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (94.44%) toHuman peptide YYActivity: Remarkably, it displayed selective antifungal activity against virulent C. albicans hyphae-but not the yeast form.MOA:fungi: PC-PYY is a cationic molecule that interacts with the anionic surfaces of fungal hyphae to cause membrane disruption (D=L) and transcriptional reprogramming that selects for the yeast phenotype.
Literature Information.Author: Pierre JF, Peters BM, La Torre D, Sidebottom AM, Tao Y, Zhu X, Cham CM, Wang L, Kambal A, Harris KG, Silva JF, Zaborina O, Alverdy JC, Herzog H, Witchley J, Noble SM, Leone VA, Chang EB. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Peptide YY: A Paneth cell antimicrobial peptide that maintains Candida gut commensalism
